subject: Ethics
title: Healthcare as a Right
description: A short lesson to help you apply Healthcare as a Right.

hook.text: In the U.S., a diabetic rations insulin because it costs $300 a month. In Canada, it's nearly free.

buildup.text: The UN declared healthcare a human right in 1948. Yet billions still lack access to basic medical services.

discovery.text: Rights-based systems argue that a person's health shouldn't depend on the size of their bank account.

twist.text: Critics say calling healthcare a 'right' ignores that someone must pay for it. Rights require resources.

climax.text: The debate isn't really about rights. It's about what kind of society lets people die from treatable diseases.

punchline.text: If healthcare is a right, the bill is a moral question.

quiz.question: What is the core tension in the 'healthcare as a right' debate?
options: Whether doctors should be required to work for free
Whether hospitals should be privately or publicly owned
Whether health should depend on wealth, versus the reality that rights require resources
